# Budweiser Case Study
## 

### Load Libraries
```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(GGally)
library(ggplot2)
```
### Load in the data
```{r}
beers <- read.csv("beers.csv", header = T)
breweries <- read.csv("breweries.csv", header = T)

#choose file
beers = read.csv(file.choose(), header = T)
breweries = read.csv(file.choose(), header = T)
```

### Look at the data
```{r}
str(beers)
str(breweries)
head(beers)
head(breweries)
```

### How many NAs 
```{r}
sum(is.na(beers$ABV))
sum(is.na(beers$IBU))
```

### How many breweries in each state
```{r}
ggplot(breweries, aes(x=State)) +
  geom_bar(fill="blue") +
  theme(axis.text.x=element_text(angle=90)) +
  ggtitle("Number of Breweries by State") +
  xlab("State") +
  ylab("Count")
```

#merge datasets on Brewery_id
```{r}
names(breweries)[1] <- "Brewery_id"
df1 <- merge(beers, breweries, by = "Brewery_id", all = T)

df1
```

```{r - Number 6}
#Summary stats of ABV
summary(df1$ABV)

#Histogram of ABV in df1
df1 %>% ggplot(aes(x=ABV)) + geom_histogram(fill = "blue") + ggtitle("Distribution of Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)") + labs(x="Alcohol by volume of the beer (ABV)", y="Frequency")


```
